Open Data Book Club

Promoting Open Data on PEI

(a project by PEI Developers)

Quick RSVP

To RSVP for our first meeting on Sept. 22, use our MeetUp site or send an email to peidevs@gmail.com

What is it?

A regular meetup for civic-minded individuals to present / discuss open data. We won’t be studying books: we’ll study data sets. Check out this site for more information.

We aim to include engaged citizens, government actors (the blue shirts!), map geeks, librarians, software nerds, statisticans – anyone who is interested in Open Data and its potential on PEI.

Why PEI?

Inspired by a lightning talk at CODS15, some members of PEI Developers would like to join Ottawa, Montreal, and Toronto with a similar venture. (Based on the strong turn-out for our August warm-up, many others are interested.)

As with PEI Developers, this is a volunteer, non-partisan initiative. We’re open and inclusive.

When

Our first meeting is September 22, 2015, featuring:

Peter Rukavina,
Visiting Scholar (Hacker in Residence),
Robertson Library, University of Prince Edward Island

Everyone welcome: the audience is not just software developers!

Just RSVP via MeetUp or send an email to peidevs@gmail.com
